awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Participation Grant for 2021 IEEE International Conference on Green and Sustainable Computing (IEEE IGSC)
awd_abstract_narration:
The goal of this proposal is for participation support for undergraduate and graduate students to attend the Twelfth International Green and Sustainable Computing Conference (IGSC), which will be a Live Virtual Event. In particular, this is to provide students with a unique experience through the virtual conference attendance where they can present their work at the Student Research Forum and meet with peers and experts in their research area. These funds will focus on women, underrepresented minorities,
and non-author students and provide them the opportunity to virtually attend the conference and participate in its Student Research Forum.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
The Twelfth International Green and Sustainable Computing Conference (IGSC) [https://www.igscc.org] was held in October 2021 as a Live Virtual Conference. IGSC is technically cosponsored by IEEE and addresses key issues and topics related to energy efficiency in computing as well as computational sustainability. The conference aims to provide a forum to a wide audience for discussing, sharing, and investigating the state-of-the-art for all aspects of green and sustainable computing, ranging from energy-efficient algorithm and software designs to power-aware circuit, architecture, and hardware designs to sustainable large-scale supercomputers, cloud services, and data centers.

The conference program included:

  1. Peer-reviewed paper presentations in multiple technical sessions.
  2. A Student Research Forum poster-presentation session.
  3. Two keynote speeches: Tulika Mitra, National University of Singapore, and Tajana Simunic Rosing, University of California, San Diego.
  4. Five workshops in various areas of sustainable computing: AI at the Edge Workshop; Workshop on Computing with Unconventional Technologies (CUT); Third Workshop on Energy-Efficient Machine Learning (E2ML), Neuromorphic Computing: from Material to Algorithm (NeuMA), and 3rd International Workshop on Application of Big Data Analytics to Cyber-Physical Systems (BIGDATACPS'2021). 

The NSF student participation funds were used to support 23 students-with 26% students from minoritized groups- from 15 different universities to attend the online conference. The students participated in the Student Research Forum poster session and presented their research work in the areas of sustainable computing and computational sustainability. The students had many opportunities to interact with senior researchers in the green computing area and enjoyed networking occasions with fellow student researchers, all throughout multiple and varied online activities and sessions designed for the Live Virtual IGSC Conference. 

 


Last Modified: 10/01/2022
Modified by: Arman Roohi
